description.narrative: - Promoting financial inclusion and deepening the Non-Banking Financial Institution ("NBFI") Sector in Indonesia: Financing Indosurya will help increase access to financial services in Indonesia and strengthen the NBFI and finance sector, which is still heavily dominated by banks. - Increasing Access to SME Finance, by increasing outreach to small and medium scale entrepreneurs: The Project will support the Company to grow its lending to SMEs, which will in turn stimulate economic growth, create jobs, help reduce poverty. It will also expand opportunities for the underserved low to middle income groups, as Indosurya will be able to increase its outreach by inclusion of local entrepreneurs into the formal financial sector. - Creating a Demonstration Effect: IFC's engagement with Indosurya is likely to encourage other industry peers to enter into the SME segment, especially since The Financial Services Regulator, Otoritas Jasa Keuangan, has recently allowed multifinance companies to enter the multipurpose financing space.

table, .k-table{ border-collapse:collapse; width:100%; table-layout:fixed; margin-bottom: 15px;} .k-table, .k-table td, table, table td {outline: 0;border: 1px solid #000; } .k-table td, table td { padding: 5px; } The proposed project comprises of providing, PT Indosurya Inti Finance (Indosurya or Company), a multi finance company based in Indonesia, a secured senior loan of up to US$80 million. IFC shall participate with up to US$35 million while the balance will be mobilized through a parallel or B loan on a best effort basis. The security is expected to include a pledge over specific eligible receivables. The funding shall be used to support the growth of the Companys small and medium enterprises (SME) portfolio. Indosurya started operations in 2011 and now operates with an asset base of US$230 million as of December 31, 2016 serving close to 2,000 clients.
